intro: The following army list allows you to field an army based on the Emperor's Children Traitor Legion. The Emperor's Children are a fast moving, agile army relying on daemons to bolster their relatively small formations.
strategy: Chaos Space Marine armies have a Strategy Rating of 4.
Initiative: All Emperor's Children Core, Support and the Chosen formation have an Initiative Rating of 1+. All other formations have an Initiative Rating of 2+.

formations.name: Emperor's Children Retinue
formations.units: One Noise Lord, three Noise Marines, three Chaos Space Marines, Daemonic Pact

formations.name: Emperor's Children Terminators
formations.units: One Noise Lord, four Sirenshriek Terminators, Daemonic Pact

sections.name: Emperor's Children Elite Formations
sections.description: One Elite formation may be taken per Core formation

formations.name: Chosen
formations.units: Four Chosen, two Emperor's Children Rhinos, Daemonic Pact
extraUnits: Replace two Emperor's Children Rhinos with two Emperor's Children Dreadnoughts: 75 points

sections.name: Emperor's Children Support Formations
sections.description: Two Support formations may be taken per Core formation

formations.name: Bike Company
formations.units: One Noise Lord, six Chaos Assault Bikes, Daemonic Pact

formations.name: Raptor Cult
formations.units: One Noise Lord, four Raptors, Daemonic Pact

formations.name: Armoured Company
extraUnits: Replace four Emperor's Children Predators with four Emperor's Children Land Raiders: 50 points

sections.name: Dark Mechanicus Daemon Engines and Chaos Navy
sections.description: Up to a third of the points available may be spent on these formations

sections.name: Daemon Pool
sections.description: Any amount may be spent on Daemon Pool points

formations.name: Lesser Daemon Pool
formations.units: Any amount of Lesser Daemon Pool points

formations.name: Greater Daemon Pool
formations.units: Any amount of Greater Daemon Pool points. The first one is free.

upgrades.title: Emperor's Children Upgrades
upgrades.description: Each upgrade may be taken once per formation

items.name: Battleship
items.description: Replace the Devastation Class Cruiser with a Despoiler Class Battleship

options.description: Replace the Noise Lord with a Noise Warlord
Replace the Noise Lord and its unit with a Daemon Prince of Slaanesh

items.name: Retinue Transport
items.description: Add Rhinos or Land Raiders to the formation, up to the number required to transport all infantry units in the formation

options.description: Add up to three Emperor's Children Rhinos
Add up to three Emperor's Children Land Raiders

items.name: Terminator Transport
items.description: Replace one Sirenshriek Terminator with three Emperor's Children Land Raiders

items.name: Dreadnoughts
items.description: Add up to two Emperor's Children Dreadnoughts to the formation

items.name: Champion
items.description: Add one Champion of Chaos character to the formation

items.name: Stalker
items.description: Add one Chaos Stalker to the formation

items.name: Predators
items.description: Add up to two Emperor's Children Predators

items.name: Dreadclaws
items.description: Transport a formation containing only infantry units and Dreadnoughts in Dreadclaws (formation must be deployed on a spacecraft)

items.name: Noise Marine Havocs
items.description: Replace three Noise Marines with three Noise Marine Havocs

about: EA-R Emperor's Children is based on the NetEA version of the list. Apart from all the changes inherited from Black Legion list, there are a few significant differences. It is no longer possible to play the list without Noise Marines, but it is also not possible to play a purely fearless list. The list gets a Greater Daemon Pool point for free, to compensate for the loss of flexibility that the Black Legion has. Emperor's Children Terminators (Sirenshriek Terminators) are now fearless, mostly for thematic reasons. The Questor and the Subjugator have slightly different loadouts that are closer to the fluff, while the Knight formations are no longer 0-1 but are much smaller. The Hell-Knights have slightly better stats to bring them in line with the Hell-Scourges. The 'Debaser' Defiler has been introduced from the E-UK list. The Chaos Thunderhawk costs 25 points more, like in Codex Astartes.
